page.title: 14The Watercress Line
page.content:
This station was originally opened as Medstead station in 1868, three years after the line opened, but was renamed Medstead and Four Marks in 1937.The station buildings are a fairly basic structure on the platform and a separate station master's house. The station reopened in 1983 when trains ran through from Ropley once more. The line slopes steeply from Medstead down to Ropley. The engine drivers used to call travelling through Medstead 'going over the Alps'
When Medstead station was reopened children from Medstead School, dressed in Victorian Costumes, reenacted the opening ceremony at Medstead Station, then travelled down the line on the first train.
